FDG.function_description: The sidebar menu page in the Bible Study app provides a range of options including document selection, search, audio playback, bookmark management, reading plans, history, administrative tasks (document download/loading, bookmark label management, app preferences, backup/restore), help resources, and other functionalities to support Bible study and app management.

core_logic.logic: The core logic starts with opening the sidebar menu from the main Bible reading page. Once the menu is open, the user can choose from various options (like document selection, search, audio, bookmarks, notes, reading plans, history, administrative tasks, or help) to proceed with their Bible study or app management needs. No branches or loops are present here as it’s a single initial step to access the menu’s functionalities.

steps.summary: Click to open the sidebar menu for Bible Study app

FDG.function_description: The current page is a Bible verse search dialog that allows users to search for specific verses within the Bible (or specific sections like Old Testament, New Testament, or the book of John) by entering search terms and selecting search parameters (e.g., searching for all words, any word, or a phrase), with options to cancel, rebuild the search index, or execute the search.

core_logic.logic: The user starts by opening the Bible verse search dialog. Then, they can choose a search scope (Whole Bible, Old Testament, New Testament, or John) and a search option (All words, Any word, or Phrase). Finally, they execute the search by clicking 'FIND'.

steps.summary: Open Bible verse search dialog
Select Whole Bible search scope
Select Old Testament search scope
Select New Testament search scope
Select John search scope
Select All words find option
Select Any word find option
Select Phrase find option
Execute search by clicking FIND

FDG.function_description: The "Bookmarks" page in the Bible app allows users to view, organize, and manage their saved bookmarks (though currently empty), with options for filtering, tagging, and accessing additional menu settings.

core_logic.logic: The user starts by navigating to the Bookmarks page via the 'Manage bookmarks' option. Once on the Bookmarks page, they can access the menu, or open the filter dropdown. If the filter dropdown is opened, the user can then choose to filter by 'all bookmarks' or 'unlabelled bookmarks'.

steps.summary: Navigate to Bookmarks page
Open menu on Bookmarks page
Open filter dropdown
Filter by all bookmarks
Filter by unlabelled bookmarks

FDG.function_description: Displays the text of the Bible chapter (John 2, "Miracle at Cana" from the New American Standard Bible) for reading, with additional navigation and utility icons (menu, search, bookmark, etc.) available at the top.

core_logic.logic: The app starts on page 0. A click on the unknown function icon (at position [910, 124]) navigates to page 4, where the Bible chapter text (John 2, 'Miracle at Cana') is displayed. This is a straight - line flow with no branches or loops.

steps.summary: Click the unknown function icon to display the Bible chapter text

FDG.function_description: The current page (settings/options menu) provides functionality to configure Bible reading preferences such as enabling/disabling tilt to scroll, window pinning, night mode, Strong's numbers, morphological codes, and accessing all text options, while the background shows the Bible chapter reading page for John 2 (Miracle at Cana) with interlinear Strong's numbers.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the Bible reading page (John 2) and clicks the more options menu (three dots) to open the settings/options menu. This menu provides options to configure preferences like tilt to scroll, window pinning, night mode, Strong's numbers, morphological codes, and access to all text options, with the Bible chapter page remaining visible in the background.

steps.summary: Click the more options menu (three dots) to open the settings/options menu.

FDG.function_description: The current page in the Bible Study app's Document section allows users to manage or choose Bible documents, with options to filter by language, search, and view document types, and also provides upload and download functionality.
data_out: updated document type filter setting (all types selected)

core_logic.logic: The flow starts by clicking 'Choose Document' to enter the Document page. From there, users can either click 'Upload document' to select modules for backup (with options to select a single module, all modules, or confirm selection) or interact with the language input field or document type dropdown (with options to select various document types like Bible, Commentary, etc.).

steps.summary: Click 'Choose Document' to navigate to the Document page.
Click 'Upload document' to open the module selection dialog.
Click to select the 'NASB (en)' module.
Click 'Select all modules' to select all available modules.
Click 'Confirm backup selection' to finalize module selection for backup.
Click the language input field (for language-based filtering).
Click the document type dropdown to open document type options.
Click 'Select all document types' from the dropdown.
Click 'Select Bible document type' from the dropdown.
Click 'Select Commentary document type' from the dropdown.
Click 'Select Dictionary document type' from the dropdown.
Click 'Select Book document type' from the dropdown.
Click 'Select Map document type' from the dropdown.

FDG.function_description: The current page provides a search interface ("Find in NASB") to search for specific Bible verses or text within the New American Standard Bible (NASB), with options to filter the search by Bible section (Whole Bible, Old Testament, New Testament, John) and verse matching criteria (All words, Any word, Phrase), along with buttons to cancel, rebuild the search index, or execute the search.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 1 and clicks the 'Find' option to open the 'Find in NASB' search interface on page 2. This interface allows filtering by Bible section and verse matching criteria, with options to cancel, rebuild the index, or execute the search.

steps.summary: Click 'Find' option to open the 'Find in NASB' search interface

FDG.function_description: The page allows users to configure playback settings for spoken Bible content, including options for earcon sounds, speak speed, repeat passage, sleep timer, and provides playback controls.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts by clicking the 'Speak' option on page 1 to access playback settings and controls (page 7). From page 7, the user can either click 'Previous passage' to navigate to the prior Bible passage (page 59) or 'Next passage' to move to the next passage (page 62), with these two actions being mutually exclusive choices.

steps.summary: Click 'Speak' to open playback settings/controls page
Click 'Previous passage' to go to prior Bible passage
Click 'Next passage' to go to next Bible passage

FDG.function_description: The current page in the Bible Study app displays the "Bookmarks" section, where users can view, manage, or organize their bookmarked Bible verses or passages, with a dropdown filter for categorization and an option to add new bookmarks.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 1 (menu) and clicks the 'Bookmarks' option. This action navigates to page 3 (Bookmarks section), where the user can view, manage, or organize bookmarks, with a dropdown filter and an option to add new bookmarks (implied by the section’s purpose).

steps.summary: Click 'Bookmarks' option in the menu to navigate to the Bookmarks section.

FDG.function_description: The "My Notes" page in the Bible Study app displays the user's personal notes related to Bible study, and currently indicates there are no notes to show.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 1 and clicks the 'My Notes' option to navigate to page 8, which displays the user's notes. On page 8, the user clicks the menu options, but since the page shows 'No items to display', there are no notes to interact with further.

steps.summary: Click 'My Notes' to navigate to the notes page
Click menu options on the 'My Notes' page

FDG.function_description: The current page is a reading plan detail page in a Bible Study app, which allows users to view and interact with the daily Bible reading assignment (e.g., mark as completed, access the passage, or have it spoken) for a specific reading plan ("NT, Psalms & Proverbs in a Year") on a given day (Day 1, Nov 9, 2025).

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 1 and clicks the 'Reading Plan' option to navigate to the reading plan detail page (page 9). From there, the user can click the 'DONE' button to mark the daily reading as completed, navigating to page 86. There are no branches or loops in this flow.

steps.summary: Click 'Reading Plan' to open the reading plan detail page
Click 'DONE' button to mark the reading as completed

FDG.function_description: The current page displays the details of a history entry (specifically for "Workspace 1: Window 1" with the content "NASB John 2") from the Bible Study app's history, likely to show or manage previously accessed Bible reading sessions.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 1 (the app's menu) and clicks the 'History' option. This action navigates to page 10, where the details of the history entry 'Workspace 1: Window 1' with content 'NASB John 2' are displayed. There are no branches or loops in this flow.

steps.summary: Click the 'History' option to display history entry details

FDG.function_description: The "Download Documents" page in the Bible Study app allows users to search for and download Bible - related documents, with options to filter by language and document type, and it also displays the sources from which the documents are downloaded.

core_logic.logic: The user starts by clicking the 'Download Documents' option to enter the download page. On this page, they can refresh the document list, input a language filter, input a search term, or interact with the document type dropdown (selecting 'All types' as a filter option). The page also displays the sources from which documents are downloaded.

steps.summary: Click 'Download Documents' to navigate to the download page
Click 'Refresh page' to update the document list
Click 'Language input field' to filter by language
Click 'Search input field' to search for documents
Click 'All types dropdown' to open document type filter
Click 'All types filter option' to apply document type filter

FDG.function_description: The page allows users to select a source (Recent, Downloads, SDCARD, Drive) to open a document from, likely for use in the Bible Study app.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 1 and clicks the 'Load Document From Zip' option. This action navigates to page 12, where the user can select a source (Recent, Downloads, SDCARD, Drive) to open a document from. The flow is a straight line with no branches or loops as only one action is provided.

steps.summary: Click 'Load Document From Zip' to navigate to the source selection page.

FDG.function_description: The "Manage Bookmark Labels" page in the Bible Study app allows users to create new bookmark labels and confirm actions related to bookmark label management.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 1 and clicks the 'Manage Bookmark Labels' option to navigate to page 13. Then, on page 13, the user clicks to confirm bookmark label management, completing the action.

steps.summary: Click 'Manage Bookmark Labels' to go to page 13
Click to confirm bookmark label management

FDG.function_description: The "Application preferences" page in the Bible Study app allows users to configure various app - related settings such as navigation to verse, link opening behavior, screen - related options (like keeping the screen on, fullscreen settings), and night mode switching.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on page 1 (menu page). The user clicks the 'Application preferences' option, which navigates to page 14 (Application preferences page) to access settings like verse navigation, link behavior, screen options, and night mode.

steps.summary: Click 'Application preferences' to navigate to its page

FDG.function_description: The current page (Backup & Restore options menu) provides functionality to backup and restore the application database and documents, allowing users to save or retrieve their Bible study app data and documents.
data_in: backup module selection (New American Standard Bible (en))
data_out: updated backup module selection (New American Standard Bible (en))
updated backup module selection (all modules selected)

core_logic.logic: The user starts by clicking the 'Backup & Restore' option to open the menu. From there, they can choose to backup the application database (leading to selecting phone storage) or backup documents (leading to selecting modules, with options to select a specific module, all modules, or confirm the selection).

steps.summary: Click 'Backup & Restore' to open the options menu.
Click 'Backup application database' to open destination selection.
Select phone storage for database backup.
Click 'Backup Documents' to open module selection.
Select 'New American Standard Bible (en)' module.
Click 'Select all' to choose all modules.
Confirm the backup module selection.

FDG.function_description: The current page functions as a help and tips information display for the Bible Study app, providing guidance on navigation, context menus, and window pinning features.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 1 and clicks the 'Help & tips' option to navigate to page 16, which displays help and tips information. Then, the user clicks the 'Close help dialog' option to exit the help page and return to page 109.

steps.summary: Click 'Help & tips' to open help information page
Click 'Close help dialog' to exit help page

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 2 (with a Bible chapter and a 'Find in NASB' dialog). The core logic is clicking the 'Rebuild index' button in the dialog, which transitions to page 48. There are no branches or loops as it's a single action flow.

steps.summary: Click the 'Rebuild index' button in the 'Find in NASB' dialog.

FDG.function_description: The "Manage Bookmark Labels" page allows users to create new labels for bookmarks (via the "NEW LABEL" button) and confirm actions (via the "OK" button) related to bookmark label management, likely after initiating the process from the bookmark management or Bible reading context.

core_logic.logic: The process starts on the Bookmarks page (page 3). The user clicks the tag filter icon, which navigates to the Manage Bookmark Labels page (page 13). From there, the user can either create a new label using the 'NEW LABEL' button or confirm actions with the 'OK' button, though the provided action only covers the initial navigation to the management page.

steps.summary: Click the tag filter icon on the Bookmarks page to navigate to the Manage Bookmark Labels page.

FDG.function_description: This page allows users to select, manage, create, or save workspaces related to Bible reading, with options to dismiss, create a new workspace, or save changes to the current workspace.

core_logic.logic: The workflow starts by opening the workspaces menu (S1). Then, it proceeds to initiate the creation of a new workspace (S2), which brings up a dialog to name the workspace. At this point, the user can either input a name for the new workspace (S3) or confirm the new workspace creation by clicking OK (S4).

steps.summary: Open workspaces menu to select or manage workspaces
Click to create new workspace, opening name dialog
Click input field to name new workspace
Click OK to confirm new workspace creation

core_logic.logic: The process starts on page 5. The user clicks the 'Toggle tilt to scroll' option, which leads to page 111. This action toggles the tilt-to-scroll feature, completing the functional point's execution.

steps.summary: Click the 'Toggle tilt to scroll' option

core_logic.logic: The process starts on page 5. The user clicks the 'Toggle window pinning' option, which transitions to page 112. This action toggles the window pinning setting (e.g., from on to off or vice versa) as indicated by the checkbox state change.

steps.summary: Click the 'Window pinning' toggle option

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 5 (a Bible reading page with a menu open). The core logic is a single step: clicking the 'Night mode' toggle option. This action toggles the night mode setting, likely changing the app's visual theme (e.g., dark/light) as a result.

steps.summary: Click the 'Night mode' toggle option

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on page 5. The user clicks the 'Toggle Strong's numbers' option, which leads to page 114. This is a straight - line action with no branches or loops as it's a single click to toggle the feature.

steps.summary: Click the 'Toggle Strong's numbers' option

FDG.function_description: The current page is a text options configuration interface for Workspace 1 in a Bible reading app, allowing users to toggle various text formatting and display options (e.g., Strong's numbers, footnotes, section titles, verse numbers, bookmarks, My Note icons) and apply or reset these settings.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 5 and clicks to open the text options configuration for Workspace 1 (step S1). Then, from the text options page (page 115), the user clicks to confirm the text options (step S2), completing the configuration flow.

steps.summary: Open text options configuration for workspace
Confirm text options settings

FDG.function_description: The page allows users to browse, search, and download various Bible - related documents (including different Bible versions, commentaries, hymnals, and atlases) in English, with details like size, source, and a recommendation label for each document.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts by navigating to the document download page (S1). From there, at the download documents page (S2), the user can choose to refresh the document list (S3), filter document types (S4), or perform other actions. The refresh and filter actions are mutually exclusive branches from the download page.

steps.summary: Navigate to the document download page
Refresh the document download list
Open the document type filter dropdown

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 6. The core action is clicking the search input field, which transitions the app to page 20. There are no branches or loops as only one action is defined for this functional point.

steps.summary: Click the search input field

FDG.function_description: Displays the text of John chapter 2 from the New American Standard Bible (NASB), including verse content and embedded Strong's Concordance numbers for biblical word study.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 6 (Document list) and clicks the NASB entry. This action navigates to page 0, which displays John chapter 2 from the NASB, including verse text and embedded Strong's Concordance numbers. The flow is a straight line with no branches or loops.

steps.summary: Click on the NASB document entry to open it and view John chapter 2 with Strong's numbers.

FDG.function_description: The current page provides a more options menu for the Speak settings in the Bible Study app, allowing access to Advanced Settings and system TTS settings, while also displaying playback settings like speak triggers, speed, repeat passage, and sleep timer options, along with playback controls.

core_logic.logic: On the Speak settings page, the user clicks the more options menu button. This opens a menu with options for Advanced Settings and system TTS settings, while the page also displays playback settings (triggers, speed, repeat, sleep timer) and controls.

steps.summary: Click the more options menu button to open the menu for Speak settings

FDG.function_description: The current page functions as a help dialog for the Speak feature, offering a link to watch an English tutorial video and an OK button to dismiss the dialog.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on page 7. First, the 'Access help & tips,Speak feature help dialog' action is performed, navigating to page 51 (the help dialog). Then, the 'OK button to close dialog' action is performed, which closes the dialog and navigates to page 73. There are no branches as it's a linear flow.

steps.summary: Click to open Speak feature help dialog
Click OK button to close the help dialog

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 7 (Speak settings). They click the 'Chapter changes' toggle to modify whether chapter change sounds are enabled. This action completes the toggle operation, with the destination page being 52 (likely reflecting the updated state).

steps.summary: Click the 'Chapter changes' toggle to change its state

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 7. They perform a click action to toggle the 'Titles' sound setting, which leads to page 53. This is a single-step flow with no branches, as the action directly toggles the setting and navigates to the destination page.

steps.summary: Click to toggle titles sound

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 7 (Speak settings). They perform a click action to toggle the footnotes sound setting, which transitions the app to page 54. This single action completes the task of toggling the footnotes sound.

steps.summary: Click to toggle footnotes sound setting

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 7 (Speak settings). They perform a click action to adjust the speak speed, which leads to page 55. This is a straight-line flow with no branches or loops.

steps.summary: Click to adjust speak speed

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 7 (Speak settings). The core action is to click the 'Choose verse range to repeat' toggle (action_ref [7,6]), which toggles its state (either enabling or disabling the verse range repeat feature) and navigates to page 56. There are no branches or loops as it’s a single toggle action.

steps.summary: Click the 'Choose verse range to repeat' toggle to toggle its state and navigate to page 56

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on page 7 (Speak settings). The user performs a click action to toggle the sleep timer (specifically the 'Set sleep timer' checkbox), which transitions to page 57. This is a single-step action with no branches, as the toggle directly modifies the sleep timer state.

steps.summary: Click the 'Set sleep timer' checkbox to toggle the sleep timer

core_logic.logic: The core execution logic for rewinding playback starts on page 7. The user performs a click action labeled 'Rewind playback', which transitions the app to page 58. This is a straight - line flow with no branches or loops as there's only one action involved.

steps.summary: Click the 'Rewind playback' element to transition from page 7 to page 58.

core_logic.logic: On the playback - related page (page 7), the user performs a click action to pause the playback. This action transitions the app to page 60, completing the pause playback functionality.

steps.summary: Click the pause playback control

core_logic.logic: The core execution logic for playing playback starts on page 7. The user performs a click action labeled 'Play playback' at the specified position, which navigates to page 61. This is a straight - line flow with no branches or loops as there's only one action involved.

steps.summary: Click the 'Play playback' element to navigate to page 61

core_logic.logic: The user initiates the fast forward playback action from page 7. This action leads to page 63, completing the fast forward playback functionality in a single step with no branching or looping.

steps.summary: Click to fast forward playback

FDG.function_description: The current page is a dropdown menu for study options in a Bible reading plan, allowing users to mark completion, set a start date, or reset the reading plan, with additional options to view the passage, have it spoken, or confirm actions.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts with clicking the more options menu (dropdown for study options) on page 9, leading to the study options page (82). Then, from there, clicking the 'Done' option completes the action, with no branches as only two sequential steps exist.

steps.summary: Open more options (study options dropdown)
Click 'Done' option to confirm/complete

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 9. The core logic involves clicking the 'Toggle Psa 1-2' element, which navigates to page 83. This is a single-step action with no branching or looping.

steps.summary: Click the Toggle Psa 1-2 element

data_in: Bible reading plan (NT, Psalms & Proverbs in a Year)

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 9. The core logic is executing a click on the PASSAGE button, which navigates to page 84. There are no branches or loops as it is a single action flow.

steps.summary: Click the PASSAGE button

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 9. The core logic is to click the SPEAK button, which transitions the app to page 85. There are no branches or loops in this flow.

steps.summary: Click the SPEAK button

FDG.function_description: Displays the text of John chapter 2 from the New American Standard Bible (NASB), including verse content and associated Strong's Concordance numbers for word definitions, accessed via the history of previously viewed Bible chapters.

The flow is a straight line with no branches or loops.

FDG.function_description: This page enables users to create a new bookmark label by entering a name and selecting a style (with "Default" as the initial style) for the label within the Bible Study app's bookmark management feature.

core_logic.logic: To create a new bookmark label, start by clicking the 'Create new bookmark label' button. Then, either click the name input field to enter a label name, click the style dropdown to change the style from 'Default', or click the 'OK' button to confirm the label creation. These actions are optional steps (except confirming) to customize the label before finalizing.

steps.summary: Click to open new label creation dialog
Click name input field to enter label name
Click style dropdown to change label style
Click OK to confirm new label creation

data_out: updated navigate to verse setting state

FDG.function_description: The current page is a dialog in the Bible Study app that asks the user where to restore the application database from, offering options to cancel, restore from phone storage, or pick a backup file manually (including from sources like Google Drive).

steps.summary: Click the 'Show My Note icons' toggle to change its state

FDG.function_description: The Advanced Settings page in the Bible Study app allows users to configure advanced speech settings (like text following speech and divine name replacement) and bookmarking settings (like automatic bookmarking and saving playback settings to bookmarks).
data_out: advanced speech and bookmarking settings page

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the Speak page and clicks the Advanced Settings option. This action navigates to the Advanced Settings page, where speech and bookmarking settings (like text following speech, divine name replacement, automatic bookmarking, and playback settings for bookmarks) can be configured.

steps.summary: Click Advanced Settings option to navigate to Advanced Settings page

FDG.function_description: The page allows users to configure text - to - speech settings, including selecting the preferred TTS engine, adjusting speech rate and pitch, resetting these parameters, listening to a speech synthesis example, and viewing the default language support status.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 50 and clicks the 'Open system TTS settings' option. This action navigates to page 65, where the text - to - speech settings (like engine selection, rate/pitch adjustment, reset options, example playback, and language status) can be configured. There are no branches or loops in this initial flow as it's a single navigation step to access the TTS settings page.

steps.summary: Click 'Open system TTS settings' to navigate to the Text - to - speech settings page.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 51 (a settings dialog). The core action is clicking the 'Watch tutorial video (English)' link, which navigates to page 72. There are no branches or loops here, as it's a single click to access the tutorial video.

steps.summary: Click 'Watch tutorial video (English)' link

core_logic.logic: The user initiates the process by clicking the 'Set Start Date...' option. This action transitions the app to the next page (page 88) to continue with setting the start date, with no branching or looping in this initial step.

steps.summary: Click the 'Set Start Date...' option

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 82. The core logic is to click the 'Reset' option, which navigates to page 89. There are no branches or loops as it is a single action flow.

steps.summary: Click the 'Reset' option to navigate to the destination page.

FDG.function_description: This page allows the user to rename (or name a new copy of) a workspace by entering a new name in the provided text field and confirming with "OK" or canceling with "CANCEL".

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the workspace selection page. They click the 'Rename' option (or equivalent for naming a new copy) from the workspace menu, which opens a dialog to enter a new workspace name. The dialog provides 'OK' to confirm the new name or 'CANCEL' to abort, though the initial step here is opening the renaming dialog via the click action.

steps.summary: Click 'Rename' (or related option) to open workspace naming dialog

FDG.function_description: This page allows the user to rename (or name a new copy of) a workspace by entering a new name in the provided text field and confirming with "OK" or canceling the action with "CANCEL".

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the workspace selection page. They click 'Copy as new workspace' to open a dialog for naming the new workspace. The dialog shows a default name, and the user can then either confirm (OK) or cancel (CANCEL) the action, but the provided action only captures the initial click to open the dialog.

steps.summary: Click 'Copy as new workspace' to open the naming dialog

FDG.function_description: The page allows users to configure text - related settings for Workspace 1, including toggling options like Strong's numbers, footnotes, section titles, verse numbers, bookmarks, and My Note icons, and also provides options to reset, cancel, or confirm the changes.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts with clicking 'Workspace settings' (from page 116 to 115). This action navigates to the Workspace 1 text options page, where users can then toggle text-related settings, and choose to reset, cancel, or confirm changes. The initial step is accessing the settings page via the click action.

steps.summary: Click 'Workspace settings' to navigate to Workspace 1 text options page

FDG.function_description: This page allows the user to select specific Bible reading settings (such as font preferences, color settings, margin size, etc.) to copy from one workspace to another, with options to select all, cancel, or confirm the selection.

core_logic.logic: The user starts by clicking to access the settings copy selection page. On this page, they can either click 'SELECT ALL' to choose all settings or directly click 'OK' to confirm the current selection (or selected settings) for copying between workspaces.

steps.summary: Navigate to settings copy selection page
Select all Bible reading settings
Confirm the selected settings for copying

branches.condition: User wants to select all settings
User wants to confirm current selection (or selected) settings
